data.headline: S&P 500 gained 0.3%, Nasdaq rose 0.5%, and Dow added 0.3% in a quiet, low-volume session
bullets: Early session weakness in megacap tech, chips, and software reversed as Apple, Broadcom, and GE led a rebound
Financials and big banks outperformed while small caps lagged broader indexes
ZIM Integrated Shipping soared after a $4.2B buyout bid
Danaher tumbled on weak earnings results
Warner Bros. Discovery climbed amid renewed deal speculation after rejecting Paramount
Ormat Technologies rallied on a Google geothermal deal; Palantir gained modestly on Miami HQ move
Oil and gold slipped as Iranâ€“US nuclear-talk progress eased geopolitical risk
Traders focused on upcoming FOMC minutes, key inflation and growth data, and late-season earnings from Walmart, Nvidia, and others
